page.title: 18Primary School's Summer Term
page.content: OUTINGS This term's work usually includes a study of a place of interest.In 1985 visits are being made to Seven Sisters Country Park,Ashdown Forest,Bowbeech Reservoir,Downland Open Air Museum,Chessington Zoo,Tilgate Park and The Commonwealth Institute.Older children go farther afield.Some are crossing the water to Normandy and the Isle of Wight. MUSIC Children with musical abilities are kept busy learning songs and practising instruments (recorders, clarinets, cellos, violins, trumpets and percussion) for concerts, plays and the Music Festival. END OF TERM Term ends with leavers parties and other social occassions.Staff and children depart and quiet returns.
